page.title: 06Toppesfield Flower Show
page.content: Toppesfield Flower Show started about 1722 when they had a fayre in the middle of the village by the pump and people exhibited their fruit and vegetables.Now it is held in the school.The Toppesfield Garden Society runs the flower Show .The Show is usually held in July but in 1985 it was held in September. A committee is formed to organise the Show and they meet in January.They decide the classes, contact 5 or 6 people to act as judges, arrange insurance and get schedules and entry cards printed. The most popular classes are for vegetables and fruit.There are also many beautiful flowers. Children's classes include handicrafts, drawing and painting, home made cakes and hobbies.Several cups and other trophies are awarded to the most succssful exhibitors.
